intro: Hordeum nekludowii, commonly known as the Nekladov's barley, is a rare and endemic species of grass native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, typical of the Poaceae family. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers, which are usually greenish or pale yellow in color. Hordeum nekludowii is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cold, arid conditions with poor soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
